name: Golden Clubmoss
description: Selaginella moellendorffii, commonly known as Golden Clubmoss or Moellendorff's Spikemoss, is a vibrant lycophyte native to East Asia, particularly China, Japan, and Taiwan. It features bright lime-green to golden-yellow foliage that creates a dense, carpet-like ground cover. The plant has small, scale-like leaves arranged in a flattened, branching pattern that gives it a fern-like appearance. Unlike true mosses, this is a primitive vascular plant that can survive periods of dryness and revive when rehydrated. It forms dense mats and is excellent for creating lush, prehistoric-looking ground cover in terrariums. The plant thrives in high humidity and filtered light, making it ideal for closed terrarium environments.
careTips: Requires high humidity (75-90%) - ideal for closed terrariums
Prefers bright indirect light to partial shade
Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
Well-draining substrate recommended - peat-based mix with perlite
Can be sensitive to water quality - use filtered or distilled water
Propagates easily by division or stem cuttings
Leaves may curl when dry - increase humidity immediately
Fertilize monthly during growing season with diluted fertilizer
